episode_title: 706 - The One With The Nap Partners

content.description: A Restaurant, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are having brunch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, the reason why I asked you guys out to brunch today is because I have been doing some thinking about who should be my maid of honor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! This is it! (She and Phoebe hold hands.) (To Phoebe) I really hope it’s you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I hope it’s you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Me too!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: First of all um, I love you both so much and you’re both so important to me…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, bla-bla-bla-bla!! Who is it?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well umm, I was thinking that maybe we could come up with a system where we trade off being maid of honor for each other. Like hypothetically, if Phoebe were mine…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes!!! Oh!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hypothetically!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Still.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If Phoebe were my maid of honor…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel would be Phoebe’s, I would be Rachel’s, that way we all get to do it once and no one would get upset.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah that’s actually a pretty good idea.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I’ll do that. So who gets to be yours?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well that’s the best part. Umm, you guys get to decide!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wh-why is that the best part?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because then I don’t have to!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well of course we will help you decide! We will do anything we can to help you! Now, I would like to make a toast, to the future Mrs. Chandler Bing (A woman at the table behind them overhears Chandler’s name and starts listening closer), my best friend, and truly one of the nicest people that…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m really not deciding!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine!
(The woman gets up and walks over to their table.)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Excuse me, I-I couldn’t help overhearing, you’re marrying Chandler Bing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah that’s right.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Huh, good luck!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aww, and good luck to you too! (To Monica and Rachel) What a nice lady!

content.description: [Scene: Ross’s apartment, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are finishing watching Die Hard on video.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Die Hard still great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep. Hey, what do you say we make it a double feature?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’d you rent?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Die Hard 2 .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, this is Die Hard 1 again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, well we watch it a second time and its Die Hard 2 !

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, we just saw it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And it’ll be cool to see it again! Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: Die Hard !!!!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, you didn’t say Die Hard . Is everything okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I just got uh, got plans.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, John McClane had plans!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, see the thing is I want to get out of here before Joey gets all worked up and starts calling everybody bitch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you talking about? Bitch.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is bringing Rachel some coffee.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, when I get married will you be my maid of honor?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God Phoebe! I mean I’m just—Wait a minute. If I’m your maid of honor that means you are Monica’s.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Well, if that’s what you want…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! No way Phoebe! I want to be Monica’s!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But why does it even matter?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why does it matter so much to you?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because this one is now! And-and it’s two of our best friends! Who knows what you’re gonna marry!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What-what if I marry Ross—Or Joey?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You wouldn’t! Okay look, Rachel I know you really want to do this, but I-I’ve never been maid of honor to anyone before! And I know you’ve done it at least twice!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah but Phoebe…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And no, oh please, oh please let me finish. (Rachel stops talking.) Oh I guess that was it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay. It’s—since you’ve never done it before you can be Monica’s maid of honor.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, thank you so much! (They hug.) Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m gonna marry someone good y’know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh I know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Better than Chandler. (Phoebe exhales as if to say, “Like what isn’t?”)

content.description: [Scene: Ross’s apartment, Die Hard has ended, only I don’t think Joey and Ross know that yet. As you see, they are both asleep. And they’re on the same couch. Which means they’re sleeping together. Not like Joey is at one end and Ross is on the other, they both happen to be lying down and sleeping together. Well, there hasn’t been any clothes removed so not that kind of sleeping together. Not that there’s anything wrong with that. That is unless you’re a Republican in which case that kind of thing will bring about the downfall of Western society, especially if they should happen to want to get married. Anyway, let me recap. No, there is too much, let me sum up. Ross and Joey are taking a nap together on top of each other and both wake-up at the same time, realize what they just did, scream, and jump up.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened?!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I don’t know!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We fell asleep! That is all.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Yep. Yeah. All right, well uh, I’d better go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think that would be best.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. All right, I’ll talk to you later.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. But not about this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! Never! Never! (Pause, then Joey wants to shake Ross’s hand.) Bye.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No touch! No touch!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica has just gotten back from brunch and is telling Chandler about it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah hey, a weird thing happened today when I was at brunch. This woman overheard that I was marrying you and-and then she…she wished me good luck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s sweet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, it’s more like a (sarcastically) good luck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So uh, what did this woman look like?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She was like 30, dark hair, attractive.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, is there any chance you were looking into a bright, shiny thing called a mirror?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on, was it somebody maybe you dated in college?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no I only dated two girls in college, both blonde, both not attractive… (Thinks a little while.) Hold on one second; let me check this out. (He gets up and grabs a photo album.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, let’s see… (Finding the picture he wants.) Okay uh, is that her? (Pointing to the picture.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God yes! Who is she?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Julie Grath, my camp girlfriend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you break up with her?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, we’re still together. Yeah we went out for two summers, and then I broke up with her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, ‘cause she came back the third summer and she’d gotten really fa-aa-aw-ow…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fat?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I did not say fat! I said, “Fa-aa-aw-ow…”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You broke up with a girl because she was fat?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, but it was a really, really long time ago! Does she still feel bad?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, apparently she does.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you know what they say, elephants never forget. (Monica is not amused by that statement.) Seriously, good luck marrying me.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is entering, Rachel and Phoebe are already there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! What’s going on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe is gonna be Monica’s maid of honor!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Well I hope it goes better than the last time you did it for that girl downstairs, remember? (Phoebe glares at him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You have been maid of honor before?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See? This is exactly why you shouldn’t lie!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right that’s it! I am maid of honor!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Na-uh, I am!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How come you are?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because I cared enough to lie!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey-hey-hey, I can help you decide who should do it! Yeah, we could have like uh, like an audition and see how you’d handle maid of honor type situations.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Like when I want a job, I go to an audition and if I’m the best of the people they see, they give me the part.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so after this audition, who decides who gets it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, me and Ross can be the judges.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it’s better than us deciding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on! This is crazy! Can’t we just flip a coin?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Coins hate me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay fine, y’know what? We will let Ross and Joey decide. (Ross enters.) (In a sexy voice.) Hiiiii, Ross! Sweetie.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey there, you handsome thing. (Rachel and Phoebe exit.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, this cologne really is every bit as good as Georgio .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just uh, brought back your videos.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh hey look uh Ross, look I think we need to talk about before.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No we don’t!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes we do! Now look, that was the best nap I ever had!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I… I don’t know what you are talking about.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! Admit it! That was the best nap you ever had!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve had better.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! When?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right! All right! It was the best nap ever!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve said it! Okay?! But it’s over Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I want to do it again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We can’t do it again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because it’s weird!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine! Do you want something to drink?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure, what do you got?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Warm milk and Excedrin P.M. (Ross just leaves.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is approaching the bathroom door behind which Chandler is using the facility.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! (Knocks on the door.) Chandler! I just figured out who you are!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can you figure out what I’m doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re Lewis Posin.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Lewis Posin! He was my best friend in fifth grade, and-and then one day I asked him to be my boyfriend and he said no. Do you know why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because you kept talking to him while he was trying to go to the bathroom?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! But because he thought I was too faaaaa… (Chandler emerges, without flushing by the way.) And every time I think about it, it makes me feel as bad as I did in fifth grade! Y’know, I-I really think that you should apologize to Julie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? Are you kidding? That was like 16 years ago.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I know. But y’know what? It would make me feel better if Lewis apologized to me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I will do it. But I have to warn you; this may make me a better person and that is not the man you fell in love with!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Ross are laying out the ground rules for the maid of honor auditions to Rachel and Phoebe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, all right, this is how it’s going to work. We’re gonna give you hypothetical maid of honor situations and you will be scored on a scale of 1 to 10, 1 being the highest.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, 10 is the highest.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why is 10 the highest?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because it’s the highest. (Joey shrugs his shoulders) Okay, Rachel you’re up first. (Rachel stands up and gets ready.) Situation No. 1: You’re with Monica, the wedding is about to start when Monica gets cold feet. Go! (Joey is playing the part of Monica.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t want to marry Chandler!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, uh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ve got cold feet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …it’s gonna be okay!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, one man for the rest of my life? I don’t know if I can do it! This means I’ll never get to sleep with Joey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look Monica, getting cold feet is very common. Y’know, it’s-it’s just because of all the anticipation and you just have to remember that you love Chandler. And also, I ran out on a wedding. You don’t get to keep the gifts.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Very good! Drawing on your own experience, I like that!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, very nice Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you judges.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh, what a kiss ass.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, Phoebe…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! Your honor?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’re now in the ceremony, Monica is about to say, “I do” when her drunk uncle starts yelling. What do you do? Go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: When Monica was a little girl, I remember that—(Phoebe screams and tackles him)—Ooh!! Ow! Very good!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Excellent! Perfect score!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait a minute! She just made a scene in the middle of the ceremony!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Do you want, do you want a little taste of Pheebs?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It is time for you to give your maid of honor speech.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, wait a minute, we haven’t pre…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Go!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! Okay! Umm, Webster’s Dictionary defines marriage as… (Ross and Joey start writing.) Okay!! Forget that! That sucks!! Okay, never mind! Forget it! Umm, umm, okay, uh… I met, I-I met, I met Monica when we were just a couple of six-year-olds and I became friends with Chandler when he was 25, although he seemed like a six-year-old.

content.speaker: Ross and Joey
content.text: Oh! That’s nice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. Thank you very much. Umm, I’ve known them separately and I’ve known them together and-and to know them as a couple is to know that you are truly in the presence of love. So I would like to raise my glass (Grabs a glass and holds it up) to Monica and Chandler and the beautiful adventure they are about to embark upon together. I can think of no two people better prepared for the journey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow. (To Ross) Good speech.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it really was!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aw, thanks!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay Phoebe, I guess you’re next (To Joey) although I really don’t see the point.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I can’t believe that Monica and Chandler are getting married. I remember talking about this today with Rachel while we were showering together, naked. (Raises her glass and drinks.)
(Joey and Ross pause while they picture the event.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And she’s back in the game.

content.description: A random apartment building, Chandler and Monica are knocking on the door of the woman from the beginning.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Julie hi! Chandler Bing, I, I guess you remember me.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Hello Skidmark.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a nickname, I’ll explain later.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s pretty clear.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, uh, I owe you a long overdue apology. I never should have broken up with you because you were overweight.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: That’s why you broke up with me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You-you-you didn’t know that. (Pause as she nods no.) Well, I guess my work here is done!

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are giving Phoebe and Rachel the results of their election. Somewhat faster than Florida I might add.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, well first of all I would like to say that you both performed very well. Okay? You should be proud of yourselves. And-and I would also like to say that in this competition there are no losers. Well, except for Rachel—Damnit!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! I won!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry Rach, it was, it was really close.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well then I demand a recount! (Hmm, I wonder where I’ve heard that before.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually, it wasn’t that close.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Y’know what? No! No! You thing was so stupid anyway, this was ridiculous—We’re gonna flip a coin! (Phoebe gasps.) All right?! (She flips the coin.) Heads! (Looks at the coin and grunts in disgust.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The coins have finally forgiven me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know what? I hope Monica forgives you after you throw her her vegetarian, voodoo, goddess circley shower! (Runs out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rach, it’s gonna be okay! (To Ross and Joey) You guys are the best!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Boy I tell ya, that judging stuff took a lot out of me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! I was thinking about maybe going upstairs and taking a little nap on my couch. (Raises his eyebrows, questioning Ross to see if he wants to join him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why-why would I care about that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No reason, I’m just saying that uh… That’s where I’ll be.
(Joey gets up and heads for the door. After a pause Ross decides to join him.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler and Monica have returned from Julie’s.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: As bad as that went, I actually enjoyed myself. I think that I’m going to apologize for all of the stupid things I do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you just stop doing stupid things? Then you wouldn’t have to apologize.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I would really love it if I could do both.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I…I have to ask.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you gonna break up with me if I get fat again?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you broke up with Julie Grath! How much weight could she have gained?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A hundred and forty-five pounds.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: In one year?! My God what did she eat? Her-her family! That’s not the point.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look I know it was a stupid reason to break up with somebody, but I was 15!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well… That’s not the only time this was an issue. You remember when umm, you spent Thanksgiving with us? You called me fat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Okay, now wait a minute that was totally different.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You were not supposed to hear that! I said that behind you back!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What if I have babies, okay? I mean I’m gonna look different. I’m okay with that, but I’m not sure that you are!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look you have to realize I don’t think of you as a thin, beautiful woman. (Monica glares at him.) See this is one of things that I can apologize for later! Look, what I mean is you’re Monica! Okay? And I am in love with Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Keep going.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you can balloon up or you can shrink down and I will still love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Even if I shrink down to two inches tall?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’d carry you around in my pocket.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love you. (They hug and kiss.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Skidmark’s still got a way with the ladies.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Rachel enters carrying a shopping bag.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! I just want to apologize. I’m really sorry I was a baby.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s ridiculous Rachel, we were all babies once. (Rachel looks at her.) Oh, you mean today.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, and y’know you-you deserve to win. And-and y’know I was thinking about it, if-if you’re Monica’s maid of honor that means I get to be yours.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Oh, umm when-when Monica and Chandler got engaged I started putting some stuff together, y’know just in case…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s so sweet thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here is a book of poetry that I know Monica loves. And-and ohh God this is funny, look, this is a picture of one Halloween where she dressed up as a bride. (Shows Phoebe the picture.) And look, she made me carry her train, which was weird because I was Wonder Woman . Oh and here’s a little purse that I found. (Hands her the purse) Y’know I just thought that maybe they could hold the rings in there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And umm, vintage handkerchiefs y’know ‘cause, people cry at weddings. (Starting to cry.) I’m just gonna grab a couple of these.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This stuff is great!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I forgot this was in here. Umm, this was the uh garter that I was saving for my wedding and I wanted it to be Monica’s something borrowed and it’s blue. (Starts to cry again.) Yeah…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know Rach, I think that, I think you should be Monica’s maid of honor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You do? Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because I think it means more to you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But Pheebs, y’know you earned it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s fine. I mean, this is something that you’ve been thinking about since you were what, 14? (She’s referring to the Halloween picture.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I was ten. I just developed early.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Man alive!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, we just decided that Rachel is gonna be your maid of honor.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, wow! That’s great! (Rachel and Monica hug.) Oh wow! We really have to start planning! I have, I have a lot of really specific ideas! We should probably get together like four times per week. You can come over to my place; we’ll get together before work! What do you say, 6:30, my place? I’m so excited! (Runs out leaving Rachel completely stunned and Phoebe laughing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah okay, you laugh now, but she’s gonna be yours. (Phoebe gets suddenly scared.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Ross are napping together again and both wake up at the same time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great nap.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It really was.
(Suddenly Rachel clears her throat and the camera cuts to the rest of the gang staring at them. Needless to say Joey and Ross are shocked and slowly turn their heads to see the gang.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude! What the hell are you doing?! God! (Heads for his room leaving Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me. (Exits.)
content.parenthetical: slowly stands up and says quietly
